clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Edetate disodium is indicated for emergency treatment of hypercalcemia and digitalis toxicity associated ventricular arrhythmias L14222

contraindications.disease: Patients experiencing an overdose may present with calcium deficiency L14222 Treat overdose with symptomatic and supportive treatment which may include intravenous calcium gluconate L14222
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Edetate disodium anhydrous is a polyvalent ion chelator that reduces blood concentrations of calcium or digitalis L14222 L14234 It has a long duration of action as patients are generally given 1 daily dose L14222 L14234 The therapeutic index is wide as high doses are generally well tolerated L14222 L14234 Patients should be counselled regarding the risk of postural hypotension effects of myocardial contractility hypokalemia hypomagnesemia and hypoglycemia L14222 L14234

incompatibilities.description: Edetate disodium anhydrous may decrease effectiveness of Technetium Tc 99m oxidronate as a diagnostic agent
